Package org.jsapar

Java Schema Parser

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BigDecimalCell
    Class containging the cell decimalValue as a string representation.
    BooleanCell
    Class containging the cell booleanValue as a string representation.
    Cell
    Abstract class which represents a parsable item on a line in the original document.
    CharacterCell  
    DateCell
    Class containging the cell dateValue as a string representation.
    Document
    A document contains multiple lines where each line corresponds to a line of the input buffer.
    EmptyCell  
    FloatCell
    Float cell contains a double precision float number.
    IntegerCell  
    Line
    A line is one row of the input buffer.
    NumberCell
    Class containging the cell numberValue as a string representation.
    StringCell
    Class containging the cell stringValue as a string representation.

    JSaParNumberFormatException

Package org.jsapar Description

Java Schema Parser

The JSaPar package provides a parser for flat and CSV (Comma Separated Values) files.

The files for the examples below are provided in the samples folder of the project. The JUnit test org.jsapar.JSaParExamplesTest.java contains a more comprehensive set of examples of how to use the package.

Example of reading CSV file into a org.jsapar.Document object according to an xml-schema:

Reader schemaReader = new FileReader("samples/01_CsvSchema.xml");
Xml2SchemaBuilder xmlBuilder = new Xml2SchemaBuilder();
Reader fileReader = new FileReader("samples/01_Names.csv");
Parser parser = new Parser(xmlBuilder.build(schemaReader));
Document document = parser.build(fileReader);
fileReader.close();

Example of converting a Fixed width file into a CSV file according to two xml-schemas:

File outFile = new File("samples/02_FixedWidthSchema.xml");
Reader inSchemaReader = new FileReader("samples/01_CsvSchema.xml");
Reader outSchemaReader = new FileReader(outFile);
Xml2SchemaBuilder xmlBuilder = new Xml2SchemaBuilder();
Reader inReader = new FileReader("samples/01_Names.csv");
Writer outWriter = new FileWriter("samples/02_Names_out.txt");
Converter converter = new Converter(xmlBuilder.build(inSchemaReader), xmlBuilder.build(outSchemaReader));
converter.convert(inReader, outWriter);
inReader.close();
outWriter.close();

Example of converting a CSV file into a list of Java objects according to an xml-schema:

Reader schemaReader = new FileReader("samples/07_CsvSchemaToJava.xml");
Xml2SchemaBuilder xmlBuilder = new Xml2SchemaBuilder();
Reader fileReader = new FileReader("samples/07_Names.csv");
Parser parser = new Parser(xmlBuilder.build(schemaReader));
List parseErrors = new LinkedList()
List people = parser.buildJava(fileReader, parseErrors);
fileReader.close();
